page.title: 14RECREATION
page.content: In the villages themselves there are few leisure facilities apart from the Chesterfield Canal and activities run through the school.{ { {CHESTERFIELD CANAL. {THE LOCK. The lock's proper name is{Whit Sunday {Pie }Lock.It was planned and surveyed in 1769,it was finished in 1777.James Brindley designed it, but he did not live to see it finished. The Chesterfield Canal is 46 miles long,it has 65 locks and 2 tunnels,but the length of the canal in our survey area is only 1800m.The tow path is still used by fishermen and people on nature walks.The canal is used by narrow boats,some of which have been restored.Some narrow boats take parties for trips on the canal.
